content.description: A nice face climb up steep patina plates and incut edges. I don't remember any particular crux, just seemed that every move was 5.9/10- up until the easier top.
content.location: Middle of the west face of Squirrel Rock, about 15' right of One Nut Needed.

content.description: Start by clipping a bolt while standing on a boulder, then crank though the short crux onto easier terrain above. A small nut or tiny cam can be placed (craftily) in the patina plates after the crux start, but isn't really necesary.
content.protection: One bolt, nut, 2 bolt rap anchor.
content.location: The leftmost route on Squirrel Rock, starting on a boulder.

content.description: Starting off a tabletop boulder, clip a bolt and do a short 2-move V3 boulder problem to significantly easier terrain and 2 more bolts above. Not a bomb, but not terribly memorable either. 0.5 stars.
content.location: The rightmost route on Squirrel Rock, starting off a tabletop boulder.

content.description:
This fantastic line is actually located on a long buttress of rock about 50 yards to the east of Squirrel Rock/Upper Walt's Rock. The route more-or-less follows the blunt southern arÃªte of the formation.

This long and varied pitch starts with a finger crack followed by a short face crux past a bolt. A right-facing corner is then gained, eventually stepping out right onto airy and exposed face past 3 more bolts on the final headwall. There is some loose stuff on the upper half, probably due to lack of traffic. Adequately protected and a worthy tick. Easily 3/4 stars.
content.protection: 4 bolts, gear from fingers to 2". A single set of cams should suffice. Gear anchor, with bolted rappel station on the north side of the rock.
content.location: On a separate buttress of rock to the east of Squirrel Rock and Upper Walt's. Rappel from the north side of the formation from bolts with a single rope.
